column4: jack_sparrow: the compiz software you just mentioned - is this on the normal repos or do you have to add a custom one

yes, enable all of them while you are in there.. and untick the cd rom.. it gets anoying

I would expect some issues trying that..
I would create the default on /  then try to point home to your old partition, if that does not work well, point it back and copy over
Assume you know this but   http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/separatehome
Documentation always helps
I would like to think they used all standard locations.. but .. I hate to assume..
Perfect example might be .mozilla/plugins
best to have the installer create one as default even if you dont use it, than need it and not have it
I just see too many things that might cause you issues like permissions etc.  and it would be nice to have a working gui to try and straighten it out
I would let ubuntu make /home on root...   try to use the page I gave you to set your old home as the new home and see if it works..
you can always create folder on root, wipe old /home and create new home from ubuntu default /homer on root and copyu stuff back
we are here to help you over the rough spots
